item.title: Reactive Overview
item.description: Reactive Streams Reactive Streams started as an initiative in late 2013 between engineers at Netflix, Pivotal and Lightbend. Reactive Streams is an initiative to provide a standard for asynchronous stream processing with non-blocking back pressure. This encompasses efforts aimed at runtime environments (JVM and JavaScript) as well as network protocols. You can read the origin specification on official website of Reactive Streams. Also, you can read the Chinese translation from here.
